title: The Dungeon
opening: Now in Raydrik's clutches, Leif was detained and taken to Munster by Imperial soldiers. His imprisonment bore a certain irony: Munster was once the sovereign land of House Leonster. It was now governed by House Friege, who had personally been installed as rulers by the Emperor of Grannvale after his conquest of North Thracia. Raydrik himself had once been a general of the Kingdom of Conote, but colluded with the Empire during the war. For that service, he was made Baron of Munster. While still subordinate to Lord Bloom, head of House Friege, Raydrik was entrusted with the day-to-day management of Munster. Leif would now see firsthand what life was like in his family's former home...

intro.speaker: Raydrik
intro.line: Hahaha! Without a doubt, this feat will secure my position in Munster and beyond. Dalsin! See that the brat doesn't so much as blink before the knights of Conote come to claim him!

intro.speaker: Dalsin
intro.line: ...Aye, sire.

intro.speaker: Raydrik
intro.line: It's high time to celebrate with a visit to the arena. You, woman! You'll be accompanying me.

intro.speaker: Eyvel
intro.line: Why me...?

intro.speaker: Raydrik
intro.line: I assumed you would want to see the other girls. But if you wish to spit on my generosity...

intro.speaker: Eyvel
intro.line: Other girls? You mean... Mareeta and Nanna?

intro.speaker: Raydrik
intro.line: I believe those are their names, yes. Never fear—I haven't laid a finger on them. I've been keeping them quite comfortable.

intro.speaker: Eyvel
intro.line: ...Are you really gonna let me see them?

intro.speaker: Raydrik
intro.line: You have my word.

intro.speaker: Eyvel
intro.line: ...Fine. Lead the way.

intro.speaker: Raydrik
intro.line: Ah, how old-fashioned, leading the way for such a fine lady. Heh, heh, heh...

intro.speaker: Ced
intro.line: This is it. Asbel and I will locate the children, but I want the rest of you to go down to the prison and free everyone locked up there. Brighton, you're in charge.

intro.speaker: Brighton
intro.line: Yessir! Once we've released these poor souls, we'll rendezvous with you.

intro.speaker: Ced
intro.line: Gods willing, we'll all meet again. Fortune be with you!

intro.speaker: Machyua
intro.line: We're counting on you, Lara. Think you can handle this?

intro.speaker: Lara
intro.line: Uh-huh. No lock is gonna stand in my way! Just watch my back, OK?

intro.speaker: Brighton
intro.line: Even if someone were to get past us, you could grab their weapons, no problem.

intro.speaker: Lara
intro.line: Not if they're too heavy, I can't!

intro.speaker: Machyua
intro.line: Then be glad me an' Brighton are here, eh? C'mon, let's go!

battle.speaker: Lifis
battle.line: Dammit... Ah, Lady Luck is so fickle...

battle.speaker: Bandit 1
battle.line: Hey, hold on... Yer that Lifis fella, ain'tcha? Weren't ya boss of a whole crew of pirates or somethin'? On the Corsair Isles, right?

battle.speaker: Lifis
battle.line: Hm? Oh, uh... yeah, but...

battle.speaker: Bandit 1
battle.line: Thought so! Hah, ya look just like the guy in all them wanted posters.

battle.speaker: Lifis
battle.line: Heh, isn't that somethin'? Guess I'm famous. Hmm... Maybe I can make use of these idiots...

battle.speaker: Bandit 1
battle.line: What, did I say somethin' wrong? Ya got this look on yer face...

battle.speaker: Lifis
battle.line: Truth be told, I'm fixin' to bust my way outta here.

battle.speaker: Bandit 1
battle.line: What?! You could pull somethin' like that off?

battle.speaker: Lifis
battle.line: Think about it, genius. Once my crew knows I'm locked up, whaddaya think they'll do? Not waltz up and ask nice for the Empire to let me go, that's for sure. In fact, I'll bet my boys are scopin' this place out right now. So since I'll be sayin' goodbye to the rest of you before long, let's make nice for now, eh?

battle.speaker: Bandit 1
battle.line: ...Really? Th-Then you gotta take me with you, Boss!

battle.speaker: Lifis
battle.line: Hmm... Well, if you can pull your own weight, I'll think about it.

battle.speaker: Bandit 1
battle.line: You mean it, Boss?! Leave it to me! Ain't no soldier gonna stand in our way, that's fer sure!

battle.speaker: Bandit 2
battle.line: Lithis? Er, sir? If'n all that's true, let me come along, too!

battle.speaker: Bandit 3
battle.line: Me three!

battle.speaker: Lifis
battle.line: Heheh... Played like a fiddle, all three of 'em! After we're busted out, I'll have a whole new opportunity on my hands.

battle.speaker: Fergus
battle.line: Huh, folk're gettin' real lively all of a sudden. So, what're you in for, kid?

battle.speaker: Leif
battle.line: ...And you are?

battle.speaker: Fergus
battle.line: Fergus the sellsword, at yer service. An' I'm this close to bein' done with Jugdral, lemme tell ya. Saw a bunch of soldiers makin' trouble fer a young lass, so I stepped in. Got arrested fer the effort. Terrible story, really.

battle.speaker: Karin
battle.line: Oh, please! You didn't just try to stop 'em, you beat one of 'em half to death! That's the terrible story, here.

battle.speaker: Fergus
battle.line: Wait just a darn minute—you were the one who started it!

battle.speaker: Karin
battle.line: Yeah, an' they arrested me 'cause they thought I helped you nearly kill that guy! This is on you, not me! So what're you gonna do about it?!

battle.speaker: Fergus
battle.line: I'm gonna take a nap, that's what. Hey, you gotta learn to take the good with the bad, you know? Just wake me when it's mealtime.

battle.speaker: Karin
battle.line: Ugh, I don't even care anymore... Oh, uh, sorry. I'm Karin, by the way.

battle.speaker: Leif
battle.line: Karin? That's an unusual name for a Thracian.

battle.speaker: Karin
battle.line: That's 'cause I'm not Thracian—I'm from Silesse. I'd just gotten into town when I got in trouble thanks to this dimwit.

battle.speaker: Leif
battle.line: Silesse... That's far north of here, if memory serves. Why come all the way here from Silesse?

battle.speaker: Karin
battle.line: Our prince up and left the country, that's why. The queen passed away, an' the princess is too young to take the throne, so people don't know who to turn to. I came here to look for our little runaway prince.

battle.speaker: Leif
battle.line: I'd heard that the Kingdom of Silesse had been overthrown by the Empire. How is it the royal family is still alive?

battle.speaker: Karin
battle.line: The rebels have been keeping them safe. Everyone still willing to fight has gathered in the city of Thove, where they've rallied around the royal family. Me, I'm gonna become a pegasus knight an' lend them my lance.

battle.speaker: Leif
battle.line: Impressive. If you become a pegasus knight, you'll be able to dance through the skies.

battle.speaker: Karin
battle.line: Well, I can fly already, but I won't be doing aerial acrobatics like a knight any time soon. Still, my pegasus an' me can already understand each other really well! His name's Hermes, an' he's just the cutest thing you ever saw, with a brain to match! He's probably the one dancing through the skies right now—looking for me, that is.

battle.speaker: Leif
battle.line: So why did the prince leave Silesse in the first place?

battle.speaker: Karin
battle.line: It's a long story. The prince wanted to go look for the king, but the king's somethin' of a flake himself. He also left Silesse years ago, abandonin' his kingdom and family both. Everybody feels betrayed, an' nobody expects the king to come back anymore. So we want Prince Ced to come back instead an' take the throne. I was sent here to meet with him, but ended up jailed 'cause of this muttonhead.

battle.speaker: Fergus
battle.line: Hm? What about mutton? Is it mealtime already? ...Oh. Guess not. Can't you keep it down until then, at least? This is a prison, fer cryin' out loud! It's not like anyone can escape all yer yammerin'!

battle.speaker: Karin
battle.line: And it's not like anyone can escape your loud snoring, either! Honestly, how can you sleep at a time like this? You are the most boorish, insensitive—

battle.speaker: Guard
battle.line: Hey! Keep it down, you twits!

battle.speaker: Fergus
battle.line: See? Even the Empire agrees with me! Bahaha...!

battle.speaker: Karin
battle.line: Tch...

battle.speaker: Fergus
battle.line: What's eatin' you, lad? You look awful upset. Might as well speak yer mind, eh? Not like it could do any harm, now.

battle.speaker: Leif
battle.line: ...You're right. In fact, maybe you two can even help me...

battle.speaker: Bandit 1
battle.line: Boss, Boss! The door's open! It happened just like you said it would!

battle.speaker: Bandit 1
battle.line: What's the matter? Yer crew came for ya, don't that perk ya up?

battle.speaker: Lifis
battle.line: L-Lady Luck really is fickle... Somebody actually did come...! Well, let it never be said that lyin' through your teeth doesn't work!

battle.speaker: Fergus
battle.line: Well, well! Hey, Prince Leif, somebody's come to rescue us! C'mon, let's make a break for it!

battle.speaker: Leif
battle.line: Who in the world are they?

battle.speaker: Fergus
battle.line: Does it matter? Save those questions fer when we're far, far away from here. Look, there's a stairway to the north that leads outta here. You go ahead—I'll give them soldiers what-for if they try to follow.

battle.speaker: Leif
battle.line: But what happens to you if I Escape first?

battle.speaker: Fergus
battle.line: Mm, I expect I'll get caught an' thrown in here again—or worse. Don't matter to me none if I can do some good 'fore I get grabbed.

battle.speaker: Leif
battle.line: I won't accept that! I'll only escape after everyone else has!

battle.speaker: Fergus
battle.line: Hah! Yer gonna make me cry, junior. Suppose I can keep you company fer a time, if'n you need someone to hold yer hand that bad. ...Aw, who am I kiddin'? After hearin' yer story, I'm invested!

battle.speaker: Karin
battle.line: Hmm. You're a more decent sort than you look, Fergus.

battle.speaker: Fergus
battle.line: Fallen for me already, eh?

battle.speaker: Karin
battle.line: Oh, please! If you think that, you must still be half-asleep. Haven't had your morning coffee yet, grandpa?

battle.speaker: Fergus
battle.line: All right, all right, lay off. But have you made up yer own mind about escapin'? The Magi's head honcho is a fella by the name of Ced. Same name as the prince yer after, right?

battle.speaker: Karin
battle.line: It's probably him, yeah—but right now, Prince Leif is the one we need to worry about. And besides, that coward Raydrik is usin' women as hostages. That's unforgivable. Any plan that gives me the chance to smash his face in is fine by me.

battle.speaker: Fergus
battle.line: You got the skill with a blade to back up them words, lass?

battle.speaker: Karin
battle.line: I... won't pretend I'm the best, but I'll give it my all!

battle.speaker: Fergus
battle.line: Yeah, didn't think so. Ah, geez... That's two kids I gotta look out for now...

recruit-talk.speaker: Dalsin
recruit-talk.line: W-What?! The Empire tried to take me own kin in their damned child hunts?! I was... I was only goin' along with 'em 'cause they promised my family would be spared! Tch...! Damn Raydrik and damn the Empire! I've no love left for any of 'em! I defect! Me life is in yer hands!

recruit-battle.speaker: Dalsin
recruit-battle.line: I take no pleasure in this... You lot shoulda stayed in yer cells!

recruit-battle.speaker: Dalsin
recruit-battle.line: D-Damn... Jubel... Live a long and happy life with yer sister...

recruit-battle.speaker: Dalsin
recruit-battle.line: They got heart, I'll give 'em that... I owe 'em somethin', at least.

end.speaker: Manfroy
end.line: Veld, how go your operations here?

end.speaker: Veld
end.line: Smoothly, Archbishop Manfroy. Some of the citizens mount a meager resistance, but their children are harvested all the same.

end.speaker: Manfroy
end.line: Splendid! Then Tarrah is the only city not under our influence. If they remain disagreeable, make an example of them: burn the city and its people. Show Munster that the Empire does not tolerate resistance.

end.speaker: Veld
end.line: It would be done, Your Eminence, but the generals of House Friege seem to have lost their nerve. They've surrounded the city, but have yet to act.

end.speaker: Manfroy
end.line: Princess Ishtar, your father appears to be openly defying the direct orders of the crown. Surely you have an explanation for this lack of resolve?

end.speaker: Ishtar
end.line: My father has been placed in a difficult position. Many of our own, as well as the clergy, are vehemently opposed to the practice of... child hunts. My own brother is among the dissidents—and I stand with him. Archbishop Manfroy, on behalf of my family, I must ask that you stop this savagery! Abducting children too young to lift a sword? Separating them from their families? It's simply unconscionable! But you don't stop there, do you? No... You take these innocent souls and sacrifice them to your dark god! Have you no shame?!

end.speaker: Julius
end.line: Ishtar, my beloved, there's been a terrible misunderstanding. Never would I condone the slaughter of children! Do you truly believe me capable of such a thing? I merely want them to be trained and educated— sculpted into adults worthy to inhabit the Empire. The ones who survive our rigorous training will become a new kind of ruling class—one that will govern over all others of common birth. Consider it: these children of peasants are given a chance to earn nobility, even happiness, for themselves!

end.speaker: Ishtar
end.line: At what cost? They compete against each other, learn to hate each other, struggle to survive without their families... You dare call that happiness?

end.speaker: Julius
end.line: ...Ah, my dear, you'll understand my wisdom—your betrothed's wisdom—one day, I'm sure. Say, there's a beautiful bed of flowers just out back. Let's take in the view together, Ishtar.
